sen.j: 宮崎 弥蔵（みやざき・やぞう、慶応3年4月8日 (旧暦)（1867年5月11日）－明治29年（1896年）7月4日）は、明治期のアジア主義者。
sen.e: Yazo MIYAZAKI (May 11, 1867 - July 4, 1896) was an Asianism activist.

sen.j: 1887年の東京遊学中に列強のアジア侵略と清朝の旧態の政治体制に危機感を抱き、中国に渡って革命を起こして人民主権の国家を打ちたて、日本などの周辺諸国を巻き込んで世界革命を起こそうと計画した。
sen.e: While studying in Tokyo in 1887, he felt the threat to other powerful countries and the stale political situation of the Qing Dynasty which led him to travel to China in order to start a revolution along with Asian countries in hopes of establishing a democracy.

While studying in Tokyo in 1887, he became to have a sense of danger in the invasion of Asian countries by western powerful countries as well as the old-fashioned political system of the Qing Dynasty, and had a plan in which he would go to China in hope of establishing a democracy and would launch a global revolution along with Asian countries.

sen.j: 1891年には弟の宮崎虎蔵に日本国籍を捨てて中国に潜入する計画を打ち明けた。
sen.e: He revealed his plan of abandoning Japanese citizenship and sneaking into China to his younger brother Torazo in 1891.

sen.j: その後、長崎の商人渡辺元の援助を受け、「菅仲甫」という変名を用いて中国語や風習などを密かに学び、1895年に辮髪を結って横浜市の清国商館に勤務する。
sen.e: Later he secretly learned the Chinese language and customs with the help of Gen Watanabe, a merchant in Nagasaki, and in 1895 worked at the Qing mercantile house in Yokohama City while dressing in benpatsu.

sen.j: その頃、孫文の元で行われた興中会の広州起義に失敗して日本に亡命していた陳少白と出会い、孫文のことを知って渡航の意思を強くする。
sen.e: Around this time, he learned about Sun Yat-sen through Chin-shohaku who was exiled in Japan after the coupe in Canton by Sun Yat-sen was unsuccessful and hoped to go on abroad strongly.
